questions.description: Which statement best describes what a "context" is in JavaScript?

choices.value: The environment in which values, variables and expressions are "visible" and can be referenced.
The value of "this" during function execution or the object to which the function belongs.
The environment in which values and expressions can be defined.

questions.description: How does an arrow function differ from a traditional function declaration?

choices.value: Arrow functions create a closure of their enclosing lexical scope at the time they are created.
Arrow functions retain the execution context of the function where they were declared.
Arrow functions can be assigned to variables at runtime.
